Hi Gordon,

thanks. I will try that. 

In my attempts to understand what is=
 going on I found the "uriPrecedencePolicy" beans which - in my understandi=
ng - are also responsible for wait times. Perhaps you can add a page in the=
 wiki explaining the ideas behind this concept.

Cheers and thanks for this=
 great crawler,
Tino

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <=
gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> You should see our FAQ pages:
> 
> https://webarchiv=
e.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/crawl+rate+considerations
> 
> ...and espe=
cially...
> 
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/unexpected=
ly+slow+crawling+on+idle+crawler
> 
> I've just added additional explanatio=
n to the latter page about the 
> factors relevant to a queue like in your =
example, in a many-minutes 
> retry cycle.
> 
> If a site you can visit wit=
h your desktop browser is showing that retry 
> cycle from your crawler, th=
e crawler machine may have been blocked from 
> accessing the site. Resolvi=
ng that, or deciding to end the crawl because 
> it's no longer making any =
progress, may be more helpful than adjusting 
> other parameters.
> 
> - Go=
rdon @ IA
> 
> t.schoellhorn wrote:
> > Hi,
> > 
> > we are using H3 to cra=
wl "Snapshots" of specific websites. As we are running the crawls I noticed=
 that at the "end" of crawl (i.e. when there are only a few queues left in =
the frontier) there are a lot of "snoozing" (inactive?) queues. Those queue=
s wait 5 to 15 min until they start to be active again. 
> > 
> > For examp=
le: 
> > Queue de,spiegel,www, (p1)
> >   85306 items
> >    wakes in: 11m4=
4s547ms
> >     last enqueued: http://www.spiegel.de/wikipedia/Gregor_Gysi.=
html
> >       last peeked: http://www.spiegel.de/wikipedia/Gregor_Gysi.htm=
l
> >    total expended: 23292 (total budget: -1)
> >    active balance: -7=
950
> >    last(avg) cost: 1(1)
> > 
> > How can we change that behaviour s=
o that our jobs finish faster?
> > 
> > Cheers,
> > Tino
